section.title: Discontinuities
section.p: When a function has a discontinuity at a, the function is sometimes continuous from only the right or only the left at a. (Please note that when we say the function is continuous at a we mean that the function is continuous from both the right and left at a.)

statement.p: The function f is continuous from the left at a if and only if \lim\limits_{x\to a^{-}}\fe{f}{x}=\fe{f}{a}\text{.}
The function f is continuous from the right at a if and only if \lim\limits_{x\to a^{+}}\fe{f}{x}=\fe{f}{a}\text{.}

section.p: Some discontinuities are classified as removable discontinuities. Discontinuities that are holes or skips (holes with a secondary point) are removable.

statement.p: We say that f has a removable discontinuity at a if f is discontinuous at a but \lim\limits_{x\to a}\fe{f}{x} exists.
